body.name: Office Chair Mat for Carpet, Computer Desk Mat,Clear Desk Chair Mat for Home Office Rolling Chair,Heavy Duty Floor Protector for Office-Easy to Clean,Anti-Slip-36 x48 Rectangle
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 16 hrs 11 mins
features: FLOOR PROTECTOR: This ultra thick office chair mat is used as protection placed underneath desks and chairs to withstand the weight and movement of desks and chairs protect your floors from scratches, dents, and general wear and tear. It is perfect for hardwood, vinyl, tile, and more.

ANTI-SLIP:The chair mat is designed with a studded, spiked underside that ensures it stays in place on most carpets. This mat's anti-slip function makes sure that it stays firmly attached to the ground, so you may move over it without being concerned that it will slide or move out of position.

HIGH-QUALITY MATERIAL: The cherry on top is its eco-friendly factor, as our desk chair mat is made from non-toxic, harmful-free materials. This makes it ideal for anyone looking for an environmentally friendly way to enhance their office space while maintaining a healthy working environment.

EASY CARE AND CLEANING：This office chair mat is easy of care and cleaning. The smooth surface makes it easy to wipe off any spills or stains.To maintain the appearance of the chair mat, simply wipe it down with a damp cloth or use a mild cleaning solution to remove any stains or marks.

The mat is sent rolled, so when it is first unrolled, the corners could still be curled. Please take a moment to go over the images and instructions before continuing. This may take up to 24 hours after the initial unfolding. Not intended for use on hard floors.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars No nubbies, but supple and flexible
reviews.reviewText: I've had a hard time finding a floor mat that wasn't utter garbage, and though I've only had this one under me for a few days, so far so good. Wanted to get in an early review for the holiday shoppers in dire need of a floor mat.The biggest problem I've had with previous mats by far is apparently the age of the mats. It seems like most of these things (online, at local small stores, local big chain branches) have been sitting rolled up in a warehouse for years, alternating heat and cold, and essentially fossilizing in the tube shape they are stored in. It takes a week at best to get them to lay flat enough to set a chair on, and then they still curl at the edges. Without some secret conditioning technique I've never found, they also crack and split because the aged vinyl has become brittle. I thought thicker mats would handle that, but no dice, and in fact it may have been worse for both curls and cracks.This fellow, though, was evidently freshly harvested from the vinyl bush right before they boxed it and sent it over. I laid it under an area rug for 2 days because I forgot about it, but it probably didn't even need one. It didn't lift the rug at all even right away, and when I took it out and put it under my chair it was as if it had been born there. Dead smooth.There are no nubbies on the bottom to keep it from sliding when you move the chair, but I've put it over the top of one of my garbage-tier cracked ones and it hasn't slipped yet. The vinyl is on the thinner side but it's durable-feeling and pliant, so I think that's actually an asset here. The thick ones cracked worse in my experience.I dunno what more I can say - it's a literal floor mat. It didn't change my life per se, but it is protecting my carpet, I'm not tripping on the edges, and I'm not worried about cutting myself on broken plastic, so it's doing its job.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I will say this was a little difficult to roll out. I had to get some help to get it flat. I laid some heavier items on the corners for a few hours to get it to lay flat, and it works great. I have this on carpet and it makes it so much easier to roll my chair on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Do Not Buy
reviews.reviewText: These mats are listed as heavy duty and anti-slip. They are not heavy duty, they are made of a pretty thin plastic. I bought 4 for our office and it was a complete waste of money. They constantly slide around causing a tripping hazard. The edges remain curled and won't lie flat despite having heavy pieces of granite placed on the edges for several weeks. Will have to now spend more money to replace all 4.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Does not work with carpet!
reviews.reviewText: I'm sure this floor mat would work fine for hard floors, but doesn't work with carpet at all!It's flat on both sides and as soon as I move forward or back in my rolling chair, the mat bunches up and moves around.cannot get it to stay in place on carpet. it slides around and bunches up and chair gets caught on the bumps etc.would have to nail it in place. not going to do that.will return and order one with the little spikes on one side that grip into carpet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good Mat, but a Little Pricey
reviews.reviewText: I needed a new mat for my husband's computer chair, and you wouldn't believe how expensive these things are. But if you're reading my review, then you DO know how expensive they are! This was a decently "cheap" mat, compared to a lot of the other ones out there. It works good, the chair rolls on it, doesn't really get stuck. We use it on a very thin rug, but it would definitely work better on a solid, hard floor (wood, tile, laminate, etc.). I knew that going into it though! After a bit of use, we did notice that the wheels do make small indents in the mat. Sometimes they bounce back, but not entirely. However, I knew it wouldn't be perfect, since it was a little on the cheaper side, and we were using it on a thin area rug. If you need a mat to do the job, and that's it, I recommend this mat. If you want something more durable and sturdy, I'd pick a different mat. OH yeah, when you get the mat, it is stiff as a board. You will need two people to unroll it and put it flat on the floor with something heavy on top of it. Watch the pokies on the bottom too. Overall, nice mat at a slightly cheaper price than others!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The KMAT Office Chair Mat is a versatile and practical solution for those looking to protect their carpet or hard flooring from the wear and tear of office chairs. Made from durable materials, this mat provides a smooth, easy glide surface for your chair, ensuring easy movement. Its clear design seamlessly blends with any decor, and looks good in our office space. Most importantly it provides for us long-lasting floor protection.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solved My Small Classroom Space Problem
reviews.reviewText: I have this set up in my classroom. I LOVE it! It’s perfect for my tiny space and makes it easier to move my chair around that tight space. It also keeps my carpet flat under my desk, which has been difficult. I'm in an elementary school classroom. I have 25 students and very little room to spare, so I have to use a small half student table as my desk ad squeeze in next to the radiator and under the phone. This makes it easy to maneuver. I didn't want to have to give up my comfortable chair since I am already trying to reduce my footprint in the class. It's been hard moving my chair around without lifting the carpet or getting tangled in cords. This has solved that problem. And since it's clear, it is very unobtrusive and doesn't stand out. Great Product!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Not a very good chair mat. Packaged rolled up in the wrong direction so that the mat is still not flat after more than a week. It's pretty thin also.Only good aspect is that it does not slide around on the floor. I'd recommend buying something else.
